mlld

modular prompt scripting

What is prompt scripting?

If you've already experienced the pain, you already know what you want it to be.

Tired of repeating yourself

"Working with LLMs is like having a brilliant intern with chronic amnesia."

Tired of curating context

"I'd do a lot more with LLMs if re-assembling context wasn't such a chore."

Tired of wrong tools for the job

"I just want to script LLMs. A chat or an IDE isn't helpful for that."

What is prompt scripting?

If you've already seen the possibility, you already know what you want it to be.

Write scripts to embed LLM context in the middle of your markdown docs.


  # Overview

  Here's the structure of the codebase:
  
  @run [tree --gitignore]

Chain LLM requests and responses like you'd pipe shell commands


@text tests = @run [npm test]

@text res = @run [oneshot "What's broken here? "]

@run [oneshot "Make a plan to fix "]

–--

"Here's a plan to fix the failing tests."

Use imports and treat markdown doc sections like modules


  @import [roles] from [roles.mld]


  @text infra = @embed [TESTING.md # Infrastructure]
  
  @text prompt = [[
    Read our docs:  
    Review this set of changes: 
    Please create a list of the tests we
    should add to cover the changes.
  ]]
  
  @run [oneshot  --system ]

  –--

  "Here's a list of the tests to add…"
